Detailed Description

Header file for eyes.cc.

In this file class Eye_manager and other data structures related to recognizing eyes of the group are declared.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum Eye_status

Enum of possible eye statuses.

Values from this enum are returne by function Eye_manager::get_eye_status() and according to them it is decided whether the status of the group is alive/dead or unknown ( Eye_manager::get_group_status()).

Enumerator:
es_full_eye 

This is completed eye.

es_false_eye 

This might not be an eye in future.

es_produces_no_eye 

This might not be marked as a false eye ( and excluded for future search ) , but virtually produces no eye ( e.g. empty point adjacent to uns_at stone cannot produce an eye right now ).

es_unknown 

Yet unknown.

enum Group_status

Enum of possible group statuses.

Group statuses in enum are ordered from the worst to the best ( from defender's point of view ) and there is also very simple operator< defined upon this enum.

Enumerator:
gs_dead 

Group is unconditionally dead.

gs_unknown 

Status of the group is yet unknown.

gs_ko 

Group is alive/dead in ko.

gs_alive 

Group is unconditionally alive.

Function Documentation

bool operator< ( Group_status  B,
Group_status  A 
)
Parameters:
[in] A Status of the first group.
[in] B Status of the second group. return True if first status < second status otherwise returns false.

Definition of operator< : gs_dead < gs_unknown < gs_ko < gs_alive This operator is neccessary for comparing group statuses in minimax algorithm in T_searcher::search However operator is defined for gs_unknown as well it should not be used for gs_unknown ( that is a special status needing individual solution )
